ygData.subject: RE: Genni?
ygData.msgSnippet: this reminds me of what my friend did the other night to a newbie beggar, im sorry but i cant stand beggars.  I can understand bugging guildmates or friends
ygData.messageBody:
this reminds me of what my friend did the other night to a newbie beggar, im
sorry but i cant stand beggars. I can understand bugging guildmates or
friends for stuff but i would never go up to someone and start nagging for
stuff. So my friend got tired of being bugged by this newbie ranger, went to
the bank, got 13000 coppers and led the newbie far from the banker, gave him
all the coppers and then walked away, the newbie didnt know what to do, he
couldnt move and didnt know how to destroy it hehe.

Sometimes life is good and generosity pays off

Minkin
Sol Ro

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kimes, Dean W. [SMTP:Dean_Kimes@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, October 26, 1999 5:02 PM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Genni?
>
> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
>
> Cool, thanks John you saved me from turning 32 pp into coppers and timing
> my
> run across the commonlands tonite ;)
>
> Kitasi
>

> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Genni?
>
>
> From: kim@...

> > Heheh - dearest sister - I don't care if you twist chant, anthem,
> warsong
> > and selo's - with 3210gp you would NOT be able to walk to the door much
> > less run to somewhere in Rathe Mts - not even with a MM drum. But I am
> sure
> > someone will try! <g>
>
> Bah, it's about 81 pounds. You can run with it just fine.
> With Accelerando and a drum, you'll probably still be faster
> than SoW unencumbered (with a MM drum you definitely will be).
>
> --
> John H. Kim
> kim@...
